channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: JPMorgan Chase and Goldman Sachs Post Surging Profits
item.description: Big bank profits surged in the fourth quarter and Wall Street roared back to life, with net income rising 50% at JPMorgan Chase and more than doubling...

item.title: Bank of New York Mellon Profit Climbs on Higher Fee Revenue, Lower Costs
item.description: Bank of New York Mellon said quarterly earnings leapt higher as fee and interest revenue climbed and costs came down from a year earlier.

item.title: Goldman Sachs shares rise after topping estimates on strong trading results
item.description: Goldman's fourth-quarter results will give investors a preview of what to expect this year, as investment banking and trading fees are both expected t...

item.title: Freezing January Weather Lifts U.S. Natural Gas Prices
item.description: U.S. natural gas futures were higher as frigid January weather increases heating demand and threatens to cause greater production freeze-offs.

item.title: Retailers post early holiday results — and Wall Street isn’t impressed
item.description: Lululemon, Abercrombie & Fitch and American Eagle all hiked their holiday guidance, but Abercrombie's growth is slowing.

item.title: U.S. Stocks Climb on Inflation Data, Bank Earnings
item.description: U.S. stocks rose, with new inflation data reviving hopes of rate cuts, and solid results from big banks setting a strong tone for this earnings season...

item.title: Australian Dollar Could Fall Amid China Headwinds
item.description: The Australian dollar could weaken slightly in coming months against a firm U.S. dollar and amid Chinese economic headwinds, Rabobank’s Jane Foley sai...

item.title: Citigroup swings to fourth-quarter profit, tops estimates on investment banking strength
item.description: The fourth-quarter report comes after a year where Citi's stock rose almost 37%, outperforming the S&P 500.

item.title: 9 questions we want answered when our 3 financial names report earnings Wednesday
item.description: Wells Fargo, Goldman Sachs and BlackRock will all post Q4 results before the bell.

item.title: JPMorgan Chase posts record profit as the bank’s massive scale pays off
item.description: The bank said profit rose 50% to $14 billion in the fourth quarter as noninterest expenses fell 7% from a year earlier.
